results.title: Open sesame: Dubrovnik
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Joe O'Brien
results.brief_description: Dubrovnik lies at the centre of Yugoslavia’s tourist development which stretches for over a hundred miles of sea coast. The United Nations representative works to preserve the natural wild beauty of the Adriatic Coast and the man-made beauty of the ancient white stone buildings and monuments.

results.title: Open school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the experimental Parkway program in secondary education in Philadelphia. There are no permanent school buildings and students find their classrooms, curricula and many of the teachers from among community resources.

results.title: Open plan (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Zero 16 Films, New Zealand. Dept. of Education and Dave Gibson
results.brief_description: In New Zealand open plan generally refers to a style of building designed to accommodate open education methods. The film is set in one room with four teachers and 120 children between the ages of five and seven years. The children work in various groupings, or by themselves, in small reading groups, and in team teaching situations. Dancing and singing are also shown. The four teachers tell how they work together, and discuss the problems they strike, and the advantages they see in the system. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zero 16 Films, New Zealand. Dept. of Education and Dave Gibson

results.title: Open Learning
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Trish Pilley
results.brief_description: The open learning (or Open TAFE) concept means basing the course on a learning need of the particular student rather than needs of the institution. It allows students to study off-campus and in their own time. The differences between ‘open’ and ‘closed’ (or traditional learning) are mentioned. Introduced and narrated by Peter Couchman
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Trish Pilley

results.title: Open house
results.brief_description: A study of some of the famous English country houses which lie near to London and which are open to the public. Sutton Place, Polesden Lacey, Knole, Penshurst Place, West Wycombe Park and Hatfield House are among those shown.

results.title: Open heart surgery
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, CBS News Production, Michael Sklar and Norton Bloom
results.brief_description: An operation on a five-year-old girl with a “hole in the heart” performed by Dr C. Walton Lillehei at the University of Minnesota hospital. Shows a special “heart-lung” machine which enables doctors to operate without interrupting the patient’s blood circulation. Suitable only for members of the medical and nursing professions and students of such professions.

results.title: Open doors ... opportunities in trade training for women
results.brief_description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. They speak about career prospects, work satisfaction and attitudes towards female apprentices. No other credits available.

results.title: Open doors
results.creator_credit: Erre Produzioni, Istituto Luce Italneggio Cinematografico, Angelo Rizzoli and Gianni Amelio
results.brief_description: During a March morning in Palermo, Tommaso Scalia commits three murders. Coldly and inexorably, he kills the superior who had recently fired him; then the man who took his position at the Facist Confederation of Professionals and Artists; finally he kills his wife. He then goes home, prepares something to eat for his son, and stretched out on his bed, waits for the police to come and arrest him. In the courtroom, the trial is about to begin. Based on the book ‘Porte Aperte’ by Leonardo Sciascia. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Open Cut
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Film Camp, Philippa Campey and Phil Burke
results.brief_description: Using extensive archival recordings of this once model town, filmmaker Phil Burke revisits his home town of Yallourn and explores some of the issues which led to its destruction.

results.title: Open classroom (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film explores some of the issues involved in the organisation of the open classroom, and focuses on ordinary non-purpose built schools in both Britain and USA. It emphasises the need for an underlying structure and a high level of involvement and co-ordination by teachers and other personnel. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
